text: I think crowdfunding is a wonderful
democratization of capital it allows
many more people to come into the
marketplace uh here to before when uh
companies had to Market themselves in
closed networks that were presented as
accredited investors by people they knew
and had to go around oneon-one or in
groups of people to promote your uh
company and try to raise Capital today
on the platforms for crowdfunding really
opens it up to anyone that can qualify
as an accredited investor uh to really
see all kinds of deal flow so that's a
good thing uh I think what we need to
look at is as we develop this
Marketplace most of it is early seed
stage funding um that is going on so
what is the next level what do this
where does this play in the food chain
of capital raising and right now it is
mostly at the seed stage and I think
that one of the wonderful questions
we'll explore um at exponential finances
what are the next stages how do Venture
funders look at the crowdfunding group
of people as shareholders in the company
will crowdfunding go to the next level
and raise significantly more and really
challenge some of the
Venture uh firms in funding uh companies
unlikely that it would be at the 2550
and 100 million doll levels but it
certainly could be at the $5 million
level where a lot of early stage Venture
firms are today I think that Angel
Investing clubs which are very popular
now around the country and I know for
those that are investing um in in women
we have you know Bell capital and golden
seeds and 37 angels and they're all over
the country but how do they feel I think
there's a little feel of threatening
their Marketplace by crowd funding and
so I think there are a lot of questions
about how companies present themselves
but I do think bottom line it is a
democratization of capital and it'll
work its way out in the marketplace and
it'll be a mature way of raising fund as
we go forward so I think it's a very
exciting time um in the marketplace and
and this I think is going to loosen up
some of the capital that is really in
the hands of individuals around the
country who haven't had the opportunity
to really see a good deal flow and they
are going to be able to access it now if
they want to be active on any of these
platforms raising funding
